title: Trump, the Apocalypse and King David: A theological reading of the US president
summary: Since his first term, the American president has frequently made apocalyptic and messianic references. Some supporters compare him to biblical figures such as King David, appealing particularly to evangelical Christians, who make up about one-fifth of Americans.

title: US slaps tariffs and stops issuing visas to Colombia over rejection of deportation flights
summary: 'These measures are just the beginning,' Trump wrote on his social media platform Truth Social. Colombia is the source of one-fifth of coffee in the United States. President Petro responded hours later ordering a 25% raise in tariffs on US-imported goods.

title: Belarus: Lukashenko extends three-decade rule in election described as 'sham' by EU
summary: The autocrat Alexander Lukashenko won 87.6% of the vote according to an official exit poll. The exiled opposition called for the result not to be recognized.

title: White House announces extended deadline for Israeli forces to withdraw from southern Lebanon
summary: Israel has said that it needs to stay longer because the Lebanese army has not deployed to all areas of southern Lebanon to ensure that Hezbollah does not reestablish its presence in the area.

title: The conservation challenges at the Auschwitz-Birkenau Museum
summary: Hundreds of thousands of objects and dozens of buildings preserved by the museum of the former Nazi extermination camp are being readied to perpetuate our duty to remember.

title: Philadelphia Eagles reach Super Bowl with win over Washington Commanders
summary: The Eagles' powerful running game proved too much for the Commanders as Philadelphia reached the NFL's championship showpiece for the second time in three years.

title: How a handful of far-right accounts influence Elon Musk's vision of Europe
summary: The billionaire's main sources of information on the European Union consist of a dozen very active X accounts with highly selective approaches to the news.

title: Pacôme Thiellement: ''Twin Peaks' taught us to watch a TV show as we would look at ourselves in a mirror'
summary: The show's remarkable success allowed David Lynch to tell his own story of America while putting viewers at the center, writes essayist and video artist Pacôme Thiellement in this op-ed.

title: US officials defend new policy of school, church raids as immigration agencies target Chicago
summary: US President Trump has been unhappy with the number of arrests so far and has directed federal immigration officials to meet higher detention quotas, the 'Washington Post' reported Sunday.

title: Iconic 'Napalm Girl' photo at heart of controversy at Sundance
summary: According to the documentary 'The Stringer,' presented at the Sundance Film Festival on Saturday, the iconic Vietnam War photograph was taken by a Vietnamese freelance photographer, not Nick Ut. The Associated Press denies these claims.

title: The British 'godfathers' of the Israeli army
summary: Two British officers, deeply influenced by Christian Zionism and the fight against Irish nationalism, are celebrated today for their contribution, from 1915 to 1939, to the future Israeli army.

title: Netanyahu says Macron allows Israeli companies at Paris Air Show
summary: The Israeli prime minister's office said Israeli companies would be allowed at the event in June after a call between the two leaders. Last year, France twice sought to restrict the presence of Israeli companies at defense fairs on its soil.

title: The outfits at Donald Trump's inauguration: Does anyone care?
summary: Under the triumphant gaze of those closest to him, Donald Trump officially became the 47th president of the United States in Washington, DC, on Monday, January 20. It was a ceremony in his image.

title: South Korean president indicted as 'ringleader of an insurrection'
summary: Prosecutors ordered the suspended president, Yoon Suk Yeol, remain in detention.

title: Why does global hunger remain stubbornly high?
summary: Over the past decade, the number of undernourished people in the world has stagnated and even increased. The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations points to a lack of funding.

title: At Sarkozy's trial, court examines lawyers' mysterious trip to Libya
summary: The prosecution claims that Thierry Herzog and Francis Szpiner were asked to look for a way of lifting the international arrest warrant for Abdallah al-Senoussi, convicted in 1999 for the bombing of UTA flight 772.

title: Trump proposes relocating Palestinians of Gaza to Egypt and Jordan
summary: Egypt rejected the forced displacement of Palestinians after US President Trump said 'We just clean out that whole thing,' speaking to reporters. Palestinian and Jordanian leaders also spoke out against the idea.

title: In pictures: India's Kumbh Mela festival draws millions to the banks of the Ganges
summary: According to the Indian government, some 400 million people were expected to attend the Maha Kumbh Mela, the most important religious event in Hinduism, held this year in Prayagraj from January 13 to February 26.

title: After weeks of wildfires, Southern California rain helps firefighters but creates risk of flooding and toxic ash runoff
summary: Flood watches are in effect through 4 pm Monday. Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass issued an executive order last week to expedite cleanup efforts and mitigate the environmental impacts of fire-related pollutants.

title: Online clairvoyance services: Behind the scenes of an industrial-scale scam
summary: Le Monde investigated New Lotus Web, an online fortune-telling company that has been offering personalized psychic services for 10 years. In reality, the messages are mass-produced by subcontractors, a practice that comes under the heading of fraud. Over a million people may have been targeted by the financial scam.

title: Tal Bruttmann: 'Images of Nazi camps don't say what we have made them say'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde to mark the 80th anniversary of the discovery of Auschwitz, the Holocaust specialist explains that our understanding of the genocide remains distorted by the images captured by the Allies, which fail to reflect its complex reality.

title: Gazans can return home as more hostage releases agreed
summary: The breakthrough preserves a fragile ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war, which has devastated the Gaza Strip and displaced nearly all its residents, paving the way for more hostage-prisoner swaps under a deal aimed at ending the more than 15-month conflict.

title: Pianist Bella Schütz reveals herself in a luminous juxtaposition of Bach and Chopin
summary: 'Chiaroscuro,' the 22-year-old French performer's debut album, explores the notion of fantasy.

title: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels claim Goma, which Congo calls a 'declaration of war'
summary: In a statement, the rebels urged residents of Goma to remain calm and for members of the Congolese military to assemble at the central stadium.

title: Autocrat Alexander Lukashenko grants himself landslide presidential victory in Belarus
summary: The president of the former Soviet republic, who has been in power since 1994, allegedly won over 87% of the vote. The EU has called the election as a 'sham.'

title: Desperation in Mexican border migrant shelters: 'We're stuck here, unable to move forward'
summary: Mexican asylum seekers are up against the abrupt deactivation of the US Customs and Border Protection appointment app by the Trump administration.

title: Wembanyama leaves Paris defeated but celebrated by French crowd
summary: The French NBA sensation suffered a heavy defeat on Saturday as the San Antonio Spurs lost to the Indiana Pacers at the Accor Arena (98-136). This setback couldn't diminish the enthusiasm of the Parisian crowd.
